Package oy.tol.tra

Class ParenthesisChecker

java.lang.Object
oy.tol.tra.ParenthesisChecker
public class ParenthesisChecker extends Object
Uses the StackInterface implementation to check that parentheses in text files match.

TODO: Students, implement the checkParentheses() method using your StackImplementation to check if parentheses in the two test files match or not.

NOTE: The Person.json test file has an error, but the tests expect that. So the test will not fail with that file -- the erroneus json file is _expected_.

Note that you do not have to instantiate this class anywhere. The ParenthesisTests:

  • Constructs your implementation of the StackImplementation<Character>, and
  • Calls ParenthesisChecker.checkParentheses.
So your job is just to have a working StackImplementation and implement the ParenthesisChecker.checkParentheses. Then execute the ParenthesisTests.

  • Method Details

    • checkParentheses

      public static int checkParentheses(StackInterface<Character> stack, String fromString) throws oy.tol.tra.ParenthesesException, StackAllocationException
      TODO: Implement this function which checks if the given string has matching opening and closing parentheses. It should check for matching parentheses:

      Lorem ipsum ( dolor sit { amet, [ consectetur adipiscing ] elit, sed } do eiusmod tempor ) incididunt ut...,

      which can be found for example in Java source code and JSON structures.

      If the string has issues with parentheses, you should throw a ParenthesisException with a descriptive message and error code. Error codes are already defined for you in the ParenthesesException class to be used.

      What is to be tested:

      • when an opening parenthesis is found in the string, it is successfully pushed to the stack.
      • when a closing parenthesis is found in the string, a matching opening parenthesis is popped from the stack.
      • when popping a parenthesis from the stack, it must not be null. Otherwise string has too many closing parentheses.
      • when the string has been handled, and if the stack still has parentheses, there are too few closing parentheses.
      Parameters:
      stack - The stack object used in checking the parentheses from the string.
      fromString - A string containing parentheses to check if it is valid.
      Returns:
      Returns the number of parentheses found from the input in total (both opening and closing).
      Throws:
      oy.tol.tra.ParenthesesException - if the parentheses did not match as intended.
      StackAllocationException - If the stack cannot be allocated or reallocated if necessary.
